step.cmd: In the Order Management page, select a line in the Line drop-down list box.
step.stepresult: The Released page appears, displaying a list of work orders associated with the selected line.

step.cmd: In the Released page, select a work order that you want to prioritize.
In the Priority box, enter a value for the priority of the work order.

info.note: The quantity must be a positive integer, where 1 denotes the highest priority and 0 denotes the lowest priority. If you do not enter a value in the PRIORITY box for a work order, a message appears indicating that you must enter a value.

step.cmd: Select to manually refresh the work orders in the Released page after you prioritize a work order.
step.stepresult: The Released page displays a list of work orders in a table with an ascending sort applied in the PRIORITY and PLAN START fields (the field values of the work orders with highest priority and the latest planned start date appear first in the table).

taskbody.result: The selected work order is prioritized.
